title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: You get given jobs all the time; that’s the nature of being a monster hunter. This is the first time you’ve been asked to defend ants’ nests though. Turns out the ants round here are being used for some important scientific research; new technology could be unlocked through understanding how ants carry so much weight, they say. The issue is Barroth, smashing its way through every nest in the region, eating the insects before they can be studied. So, here you are. You’ve got a target, and you know the foetid, marsh-ridden region Barroth inhabits.

prompt.text: Get hunting.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 17.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 2 potions.

flavor.text: You’re heading after a Barroth. Big, nasty brutes, and they’ve been responsible for impeding vital research. So, that’s why you’re on the trail. And you’ve not spent long patrolling the edges of the swamps where it lives when you find a sign one of the creatures has been here. Barroth claws, wedged into stinking mud. There’s been a fight… probably a Barroth duelling with a Jyuratodus. Those two beasts love to rip each other to pieces. But there’s a Barroth nearby. Time to track it down.

prompt.text: Get straight after the beast.

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 8.

prompt.text:
Spend a little more time in this area.
The Barroth might return.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Each hunter gains 1 Monster Bone medium.
Progress to entry 11.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 5 time cards. Progress to entry 30.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: Ants. Swarming ants. Too many legs, too many sharp mandibles… too many ants. And you’re having to head into the midst of them to stop a Barroth from eating them. No one ever said being a hunter was a normal way to make a living. But researchers need the ants alive, and not swallowed up by the rampaging Barroth. So here you are, hunkering down amidst a horde of surviving ants and working out where the creature gorging itself on them goes next…

prompt.text: Bait a trap, luring Barroth back towards you.

rules.text: Gain and reveal 1 track token, then choose whether to keep or discard it. Progress to entry 20.

prompt.text: Head deeper into the swamp in search of the beast.

rules.text: Gain 2 track tokens. Progress to entry 10.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 5 time cards. Progress to entry 30.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 2 potions.

flavor.text: Another demolished ant’s nest. That’s what you’re confronted by. Again. It’s been a day of traipsing through bug-infested swampland, your eyes stinging from the noxious gases oozing out of the foetid bog all around you. And for what? So some researchers can find an unharmed ant nest. You’re on the hunt for a Barroth; might as well get to it.

prompt.text: Follow a path of twisted roots, and broken branches.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 26.

prompt.text: Strange noises are audible from just over the way. Investigate.

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 14.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 5 time cards. Progress to entry 30.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: Researchers say that a Barroth is attacking everything in the nearby swamp. They’re trying to get hold of a series of sample ants, to start building some new technology, and they’ve been unable to. Barroth has ruined every venture they’ve made into the swamp. Smashing encampments to pieces, fighting any other creature that crosses its path. As soon as you enter the swamp, you can see what they mean. There are bones everywhere. Time to hunt.

prompt.text: Study Barroth’s movements. Something is driving it on. Might be able to find out what.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 2 track tokens.
Progress to entry 19.

prompt.text: There are rich pickings for those prepared to spend some time looking…

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Each Hunter gains 1 Barroth Claw and 1 Monster Bone large.
Progress to entry 25.

prompt.text: Get straight on the creature’s trail.

rules.text: Discard 2 time cards. Progress to entry 24.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 5 time cards. Progress to entry 30.

flavor.text: You race along after Barroth. It hasn’t tried to conceal its tracks at all, simply forced its way through the environment as brutally, and efficiently, as it can. Its path is easy to see, and to follow… but that doesn’t mean it’s safe. Do you try and follow the same path as the creature, or hold back, taking your time?

prompt.text: Hurry! Every second counts!

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards.
Each hunter suffers 1 damage, then gains 1 Barroth Ridge.
Progress to entry 23.

prompt.text: Be wary, no point in risking anything yet.

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 15.

flavor.text: You curse. Not footprints. The mud here is different to that elsewhere in the swamp, and, with the light distorting your vision, it was an easy mistake. Still, the mud should be useful in itself, and you’ve time to rest now.

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Fertile Mud, then add 1 potion to the pool. Progress to entry 21.

flavor.text: A discarded hunter’s pack lies open. You wait a while, to see if anyone returns, but whoever it belonged to is long gone. There’s something glinting beneath the fabric, though. Might be worth investigating.

consequences.text: Each hunter gains 1 Carbalite ore, and 1 Machalite ore.

prompt.text: Investigate the mysterious cloud to the east.

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 23.

prompt.text: Open the pack and root through.

rules.text: Discard 2 time cards. Progress to entry 28.

flavor.text: Two Barroth? There are two Barroth now? The swamp here is a berserk array of uprooted plant life, trampled animals, and smashed pieces of Barroth. Two Barroth fought it out over this territory, and you’ve no idea which came off better. So, now there are likely two furious hulking monsters rampaging through the swamp. Be careful.

prompt.text: There should be an ant colony nearby. Next step might be to visit there.

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards. Each hunter gains 1 Barroth Shell.
If the group has at least 1 Barroth Ridge, each hunter also gains 1 Barroth Ridge. Progress to entry 12.

prompt.text: What are those noises, just over there?

rules.text: Progress to entry 14.

flavor.text: The journey through the swamp is tiring, the mud sucks at your feet, making each step a labour. But you’re certain you’re gaining on the beast. The stickiness of the marsh means any tracks are swiftly consumed, but you know Barroth is nearby. You can feel it.

rules.text:
Roll a die.
On a 1-2 progress to entry 6.
On a 3-4 add 1 Potion to the pool. Progress to entry 6.
On a 5-6 each hunter gains 1 Fertile Mud. Progress to entry 15.

flavor.text: There’s no sign the creature intends to return to the area, but you find more of its spore. It was a brutal fight, by the looks of thing. Remnants of it are everywhere. But the beast isn’t returning.

prompt.text: Collect the relics of the battle.

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards.
Each hunter gains 1 Monster Bone large and 1 Barroth Shell.
Progress to entry 27.

prompt.text: Make up for lost time!

rules.text: Progress to entry 6.

flavor.text: The area around the ant colony is a mass of disrupted, uprooted earth. Almost as though Barroth was less a beast than a plough. You’re uncertain what move to make next. You could conduct a more thorough search of the nest – there might be something in there a researcher would pay handsomely for. Or you could rest up. The area is open, and anything that might attack you was probably scared off by Barroth. Or you can keep up the hunt. What’s your next move?

prompt.text: You swear you can hear something, just beyond that hill. Keep going.

rules.text:
Shuffle the Rushed Advance card into the time deck.
Progress to entry 30.

prompt.text: Rest. You’re going to need it, tomorrow.

rules.text: Discard 2 time cards, all hunters heal to full, progress to entry 21.

prompt.text: Digging in the ant colony, ruined though it may be, was a good idea.

rules.text: Discard 1 track token. Shuffle the Researcher’s Favour card into the time deck, progress to entry 7.

flavor.text: More evidence of Barroth’s presence. The ground is a ragged mass where the beast’s enormous brow has gouged up a glittering spray of ore…

rules.text:
Roll a die.
On a 1-4 ignore the ore!
Progress to entry 29.
On a 5-6 I mean… it’s just there… Discard 1 time card.
Each hunter gains 1 Carbalite ore, and 1 Machalite ore.
Progress to entry 28.

flavor.text: The strange noises turn out to be a group of Palico, gambolling in a circle, and entirely unconcerned by the potential presence of a Barroth in the area. Felynes are fast enough to disappear into the swamp should they encounter a threat. The Palicoes notice you, and a few approach, looking up with their big eyes, noses twitching…

prompt.text: Ask the Palicoes to accompany you on your hunt.

rules.text:
Each hunter that does not have a Palico draws a Palico card.
They may use it during the next hunting phase, then it is discarded. Progress to entry 15.

prompt.text: They look happy where they are, but they may have information…

rules.text: Gain and reveal 4 track tokens, then choose whether to keep or discard each token. Progress to entry 21.

flavor.text: Skirting the most dangerous elements of the swamp proves an effective tactic. And you’re still on the track of Barroth. The scent of freshly turned earth is rich in your nostrils, and it’s dug up more than simply wet mud. The remnants of a long dead beast are scattered across the earth, exposed to the dying sun for the first time in centuries.

prompt.text: Stop to collect what you can.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Ancient Bone.
Progress to entry 22.

prompt.text: Offer the creature a silent prayer.

condition.text: (The group may only choose this option if they have at least one Fertile Mud in their inventories)

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Shuffle an Ancient Guardian card into time deck.
Progress to entry 29.

flavor.text: Footprints. Large footprints, set deep into the mud. Only Barroth are big enough to leave track like this. You know you’re gaining on your prey…

prompt.text: Keep up the pursuit. It’s only a matter of time.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 2 track tokens.
Progress to entry 30.

prompt.text: Explore this area more closely. The Barroth has been here. There may be further clues.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Reveal up to three tokens from the pool.
Progress to entry 29.

flavor.text: Creatures get sucked into the marsh land around here all the time. One step too deep, the quicksand seizes them…and this is the result. This beast died a few weeks ago. The carcass is picked clean, only a few strands of mummified flesh cling to the skeleton of the beast, like ragged banners above a slaughtered army. But there’s no time to dwell on such things. Your hunt needs to continue.

consequences.text: Each hunter gains 1 Monster Bone medium.

prompt.text: Press on.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token.
Shuffle the Barroth Slayer card into the time deck.
Progress to entry 8.

prompt.text: Stay and root through the carcass.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Each hunter gains 1 Quality Bone and 1 Monster Bone small.
Progress to entry 8.

flavor.text: So, this is what happens to a lesser Barroth. The creature lies at the edge of the swamp, it’s flanks opened, scored with a terrible wound. Ruined ribs poke upwards and out from lacerated flesh. It fought well. The great ridge above its eyes is buckled from where it has been driven, relentlessly, into the foe. But to no avail.

prompt.text: There is a glinting patch of mud… perhaps what drew the creature here to die.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 Fertile Mud.
Progress to entry 22.

prompt.text: One fewer Barroth to worry about.

rules.text: Progress to entry 7.

flavor.text: A trader, panicked but still willing to sell you something, is hurrying from the swamp.

rules.text:
The group may discard any 3 resources, and either add 1 Potion to the pool or gain 1 track token.
Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 13.

flavor.text: Building the trap takes some time. Then you wait. And wait. And wait. Nothing. Barroth is either significantly smarter than you’d first assumed, or it’s found other ants to feast on. So what are you doing now?

prompt.text: Abandon the trap, head into the swamp.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Monster Keenbone.
Progress to entry 15.

prompt.text: Are those Barroth footprints?

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 2 track tokens.
Progress to entry 7.

prompt.text: You’re certain you recognize more remnants of Barroth’s path ahead. Worth pursuing, for sure.

condition.text: (The group may only choose this option if they have at least one Barroth Shell in their inventories)

rules.text: Progress to entry 18.

flavor.text: You awake feeling refreshed. You might not have made much progress in the hunt, but at least you’ll be in decent shape when you encounter Barroth. You begin stalking the beast again, exploring deeper into the swamp. Barroths aren’t subtle creatures, and it isn’t long before you’re convinced you’re on its tail…

prompt.text: You’re approaching the beast.

rules.text:
If the group has four or less track tokens, gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 30.

flavor.text: It’s been a bad start. Your arms and face sting from the bites, and you’ve barely seen anything to hint Barroth hunts these marshes at all. Until now. A collection of the hardy trees growing in the swamp have been torn up and flung apart by something big, and heavy. The marks on the trunks look like they were made by Barroth plates…

prompt.text: Pursue this lead!

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Gain 3 track tokens, progress to entry 29.

prompt.text: Hunker down and wait. The beast might still be in the area.

rules.text: Progress to entry 30.

flavor.text: Hornets! Hornets! Or, at least, something that looks a lot like hornets and stings a lot like them too. A cloud of the foul things surrounds you, jabbing and swooping, as you try to fight them off!

prompt.text: Flee from the hideous swarm!

rules.text: All hunters suffer 2 damage. Progress to entry 22.

prompt.text: Fight them off!

condition.text: (The hunters may only choose this option if they have at least one potion)

rules.text: Discard 1 potion. Progress to entry 22.

flavor.text: More evidence of the savagery of Barroth you’re chasing. Another of its kin, trampled and bludgeoned to death. It took you a few minutes to determine it was a Barroth you were looking at, so comprehensive is the damage.

rules.text: Progress to entry 19.

prompt.text: You recognise a piece you might have missed at first, were you not so familiar with this creature.

condition.text: (The group may only select this option if they have at least one Barroth Ridge in their inventories)

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards. Gain 1 Barroth Shell.
Progress to entry 25.

flavor.text: The remains of a Kestodon, clearly taken down by a Barroth. Those researchers were right… this monster is very, very, angry. And even more dangerous. It’s dealt with this Kestodon brutally.

prompt.text: Examine the corpse.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Shuffle a Barroth Slayer card into the time deck.
Progress to entry 6.

prompt.text: Leave it. Continue the hunt.

rules.text:
Shuffle an Unavenged card into the time deck.
Progress to entry 20.

flavor.text: The beast has been here, rooting through more smashed ant’s nests. The broken carapaces of insects are scattered across the clearing, and the signs of Barroth’s feeding frenzy are difficult to miss. It doesn’t have much in the way of table manners.

prompt.text: Stop to investigate Barroth’s feeding habits.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Barroth Carapace and 1 Monster Hardbone.
Progress to entry 11.

prompt.text: You’re sure the beast is still in the vicinity. Explore the area carefully.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track tokens.
Progress to entry 9.

flavor.text: A mass of ores have also been thrown up by the battle.

prompt.text: Spend a little time collecting what’s here.

rules.text:
Discard 1 track token.
Each hunter rolls on the following table.
On a 1-2 gain 1 Dragonite ore
On a 3-4 gain 1 Fucium ore
On a 5-6 gain 1 Firecell ore
Once each hunter has rolled, progress to entry 28.

prompt.text: There’s no further time to waste.

rules.text: Gain 1 track token, progress to entry 22.

flavor.text: Another hunter’s pack. Or perhaps this belonged to a researcher. It’s difficult to tell. Something happened to a group of people exploring this area, that’s certain. Their belongings are scattered about this place, most of them smashed or ruined. An encampment broken to pieces by a charging Barroth. Worth examining the wreckage, perhaps… or get straight on the creature’s path.

prompt.text: Examine the debris.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Each hunter rolls on the following table.
On a 1-2 gain 1 Dragonite ore
On a 3-4 gain 1 Fucium ore
On a 5-6 gain 1 Ancient Bone
Once each hunter has rolled, progress to entry 16.

prompt.text: No time for that. Keep hunting.

rules.text: Progress to entry 30.

flavor.text: A smashed ant nest confronts you as you chase Barroth. The colony lies open, its inhabitants either eaten or crushed under huge, charging feet. No wonder the researchers want the beast dealt with. It leaves little behind to give you a clue as to its next move, now it’s fed. Time to make a choice.

prompt.text: Those might be footprints…

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token, progress to entry 7.

prompt.text: Spend a little more time with the nest.

rules.text: Discard 1 track token, progress to entry 12.

flavor.text: Your instincts are good. Only a few minutes later, you hear the odd trumpeting cry of Barroth, the grunting and smashing as it hurls aside great clumps of sodden earth in search of food. It’s nearly upon you. Brace yourselves for the fight.

rules.text: Reveal your track tokens, check the Scoutfly level, and begin the hunting phase.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: There’s been chaos over the last week. Monsters, driven from their habitats, careening through the forest and further abroad. Several settlements have been left ruined, traders have seen their livelihoods smashed beneath the trampling feet of stampeding Kestodon. So you’ve been called in. Only one creature is capable of causing this kind of havoc among other beasts; a Pukei-Pukei. So now you’re going to have venture into the forest, deal with the thing, and hope that life returns to normal, or as normal as it gets round here.

flavor.text: A Pukei-Pukei’s presence is never a good thing. It’s a vicious, craven creature; attacking anything smaller than it, forcing them out of their nests and territories and making everything that little bit more dangerous, that little bit less safe. So, news one has moved into the forest caught your attention. Time to do a little bit of public service.

flavor.text: They’ve sighted a Pukei-Pukei in a local village; saw it soaring above the forest, spitting its venom down on whichever creatures were unlucky enough to be in the way. They called you; it needs to be dealt with as soon as possible. So, you strapped on your pack, and headed off. No point waiting around for things to get worse, after all.

flavor.text: It looked like a shallow hill, leading back into the shadow of the trees. But it wasn’t. What it instead gave you was the illusion of a gentle walk, followed by a swift tumble into the undergrowth. You’re more or less unharmed, but that isn’t the case for your pack…

prompt.text: Pick yourself up, and try to find somewhere to check yourself over.

prompt.text: No hunter gives up after such a minor setback! Keep going!

flavor.text: Into the swamp. In search of its most elusive and lethal predator. Jyuratodus. A creature perfectly adapted to camouflage itself amidst the mud and murk, waiting for the precise moment to lunge and fix its jaws around the throat of a victim. And some young idiot calling themselves a scholar has wandered into its domain. So you’re on a rescue mission. Good luck.

prompt.text: Don’t go in unprepared. That’s the first rule of hunting.

flavor.text: So, merchants venturing into the swamp in search of a shortcut haven’t been emerging out the other side. Which is a problem. The kind of problem you specialise in resolving. So you’re heading into the swamp to make it safer for merchants. And prevent them from ending up as Jyuratodus food. Simple… right?

flavor.text: The Jyuratodus didn’t have to return to the kill. It never went away. One moment you’re crouched next to a patch of mud, the next the creature is upon you, fangs seeking to rip you to pieces. Your armour holds but only just, as it snaps and snarls at you, flinging you from side to side. With a grunt, you free yourself, collapsing into the swamp. You brace for the next assault but the Jyuratodus is gone.

rules.text:
Draw a time card and place it to one side of the deck.

flavor.text: A slim, mercifully humanoid, shape stands ahead of you. You can’t make out much through the mist, but it must be the scholar you’ve been sent to find. They’re alive. Splashing through the murk, you plant a hand on their back, in relieved welcome. They give a great yell of fear, spinning around and slicing at you with a blade, sending blood splashing into the water. And then they are gone, running off into the fog.

rules.text: Each hunter suffers 2 damage. Progress to entry 12.

flavor.text: You almost collide with the scholar, their thin form quaking in the gelid swamp air. They turn to you, gibbering with fear, in total panic. Are they trying to say something? Then, before you can try and speak to them, they’re running back the way they came, and you’re staring into the darkness… a darkness with teeth.

prompt.text: Might as well make getting soaked worthwhile.

A Barroth and a Jyuratodus went to war here, and, from the look of it, Jyuratodus won. Though it was a close won thing. Barroth lies in the marsh, roaring in its death throes. Getting past it unharmed is going to take some doing.

flavor.text: There’s an explosion of water, snapping teeth, the vast bulk of a creature impossibly big and impossibly strong roaring past you, knocking you to the ground and driving the breath from your lungs, claws swiping at the space you were prone a moment before… and then it’s gone. Almost enough to make you feel… scared. And that’s before you find the picked clean carcass of the monster, protruding from the water.

flavor.text: You can hear it, the sound of something large breathing incredibly quietly, incredibly slowly. The beast is near, hiding beneath the mud. Before you can pinpoint it, Jyuratodus rears up in a welter of mud and serrated teeth, and you’re fighting for your life!

rules.text: Reveal your track tokens, check the Scoutfly level, and begin the hunting phase.

Always waiting, just beneath your feet, ready to swallow you whole. But these kinds of challenges… they’re what being a hunter is about. So ready yourself. You’re about to face a truly terrifying challenge.

Doing so with the express purpose of tracking and killing a Diablos is bordering on the suicidal, even for the most skilled and deadly of hunters. But what the First Wyverian asks of you, you do. That’s how it works. And that’s why you’re heading into the sands.

flavor.text: The First Wyverian fixed you with the kind of stare you dread. The kind of stare that tells you he has a quest for you — the kind of quest you’d much rather refuse but that you know you won’t. Which is exactly what happened. He gazed into your eyes, pressed a token of the creature he wanted you to hunt into your hand, and left. You didn’t want to look down. But you did. That’s why you’re in the desert, stalking a Diablos. Or trying to.

prompt.text: You know why you’re here. Might as well get on with it.

Then you remember; the First Wyverian. The First Wyverian tasked you with hunting one of the great brutes, to prove your skill. And you said yes. Feels like less of a smart decision right now.

And yet, that’s what you’re doing. The First Wyverian tasked you with hunting one of the creatures, and so you’ve obeyed. Good luck. You’re going to need it.

flavor.text: Diablos is one of the most terrifying foes you can conceive. Fast, strong, enormous in size. And now you’re going to fight Black Diablos; a creature with all of the cunning and savagery of its kin, but even faster. This isn’t one of your smartest decisions, even you’re forced to concede that. But sometimes, that’s the nature of the job.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: To discover the secrets of the elder dragons, so goes the tale, you need to gain information about Black Diablos. You’re not sure whether that means information about where to find the ancient creatures, or how to bring them down, but you’re also unsure if that concerns you, currently. The First Wyverian dispatched you to bring down a Black Diablos. That’s enough to focus on, for now.

prompt.text: Gather your resources and start the hunt.

rules.text: Each hunter gains 1 Novacystal. Progress to entry 12.

prompt.text: Seek out the advice of someone who has hunted Black Diablos before.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Majestic Horn.
Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 21.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 8 time cards. Progress to entry 31.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 2 potions.

flavor.text: The desert stretches out in front of you, an unfinished world of sand and dust and stone. Before you begin your trudge over the dunes, you focus on the purpose of your mission again. To bring Black Diablos down, as the First Wyverian requested. Let the hunt begin.

prompt.text: The Black Diablos stalks beneath the earth. The tunnels might be a good start.

rules.text:
Gain 1 track token. Discard 1 time card.
Progress to entry 26.

prompt.text: Proceed across the sand.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Majestic Horn.
Progress to entry 17.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 8 time cards. Progress to entry 31.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: The battle is ferocious enough to level a small town; a Diablos fighting a Black Diablos. You duck down behind the rocks, grateful for some barrier between yourself and the rampaging beasts beyond. With a roar, Diablos scores its claws along the gullet of Black Diablos, rending flesh and spraying dark blood across the sand. The darker-hued Diablos shrieks in pain, turning and fleeing from its attacker. In a moment, it’s beneath the ground, the sand spraying into the air as it burrows down into the earth. Well… the First Wyverian tasked you with bringing a Black Diablos down. You should probably get chasing it.

prompt.text: The Wyverian places his trust in you. Don’t let him down.

rules.text: Each hunter gains 1 Wyvern Gem. Progress to entry 4.

prompt.text: Who cares about higher duty? Let’s get hunting!

rules.text: Each hunter gains 1 Novacrystal. Shuffle the Turf War card into the time deck. Progress to entry 8.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 8 time cards. Progress to entry 31.

flavor.text: The vast form of a Diablos lies sprawled over the sand. Its stomach has been ripped open by savage teeth; its claws are bloodied but irrevocably stilled. An enormous battle took place here. What killed the creature you’re uncertain—though you suspect a Black Diablos. Little else has the means of bringing down one of these monsters. You stop to examine the corpse, to learn something about the beast you hunt… and notice the rumbling beneath you.

prompt.text: Something is coming.

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Shuffle the Diablos Slayer card into the time deck. Progress to entry 31.

flavor.text: The ground shifts beneath you, the sand suddenly unsettled, writhing like a fish on a hook. The rumbling is coming from beneath… have you found it? You think so. Or has it found you? Black Diablos is coming.

prompt.text: Find yourself a place to make your stand.

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 32.

prompt.text: You know what Black Diablos will try, and you’re ready.

condition.text: (This option can only be chosen if the hunters have at least 1 Black Diablos Carapace in their inventories)

rules.text: Progress to entry 33.

flavor.text: Above, you hear the sinister call of a Pukei-Pukei, flying as far above the earth as it can. No creature draws too near to a place Black Diablos hunts if it can help it. The slightest tremor of the ground can bring it to the surface… Being this close to Black Diablos’ hunting grounds makes you nervous. But overcoming fear is part of the hunter’s trade.

prompt.text: You’re confident Black Diablos went this way.

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 28.

prompt.text: The beast isn’t going anywhere, no matter how fast it moves. You’ve time to rest a little.

condition.text: (This option can only be chosen if the hunters have at least 1 Black Diablos Ridge in their inventories)

rules.text:
Each hunter recovers 2 health. Discard 1 time card.
Progress to entry 22.

flavor.text: The wind is high today, sweeping the sands across you in plumes of yellow and white. Seams of ore are exposed, the sand driven off to reveal glinting troves of gemstone and more. But do you have time to collect them?

prompt.text: No. The First Wyverian gave you a task. Stick to it.

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 31.

prompt.text: Plenty of time for hunting later.

rules.text:
Each hunter rolls on the following table.
On a 1-2 you gain 1 Dragonite ore
On a 3-4 you gain 1 Wyvern Gem
On a 5-6 you gain 1 Novacrystal
Discard 1 time card.
Shuffle the Time Management card into the time deck.
Progress to entry 6.

flavor.text: The trek across the sands is a laborious one; your feet sink a little into the sand each time, making the next step seem so much harder. But this is the route you’ve found, and Black Diablos is out there somewhere.

prompt.text: Keep walking.

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 7.

flavor.text: The tunnel is dark and close, unsurprising considering that your prey forced it’s way through here, and caused several cave ins.

prompt.text: Pick up any fallen ores.

rules.text: Each hunter gains 1 Machalite ore. Progress to entry 19.

prompt.text: No time to waste.

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 8.

flavor.text: You’re crouched, carefully skirting over the ground, keeping your movements to a minimum. Attracting the attentions of Barroth is not something you want to do. You take a cautious step to the left, and feel the ground give in beneath you. The earth drops in, leaving you falling downwards into another of Black Diablos’ tunnels.

rules.text:
Roll a die.
On a 1-3 you tumble downwards and have to scramble back up.
Each hunter suffers 2 damage.
On a 4-6 it’s a fresher tunnel, as luck would have it.
Gain 3 track tokens.
Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 16.

flavor.text: You listen to the wind, press your hand to the hot sand to feel for vibrations beneath the earth, try to detect where Black Diablos might have gone after its fight with the winged beast. No luck though; you need to press on.

prompt.text: That whine… could that be scoutflies?

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token.
Shuffle the Recovery card into the time deck.
Progress to entry 19.

prompt.text: Head into Black Diablos’ tunnels. You’re sure there’s an entrance nearby.

rules.text: Progress to entry 25.

flavor.text: You’d hoped you’d find something a little more substantial on this route, maybe even finally encounter the beast itself. Still, judging from the swarming scoutflies, there’s something just beyond that sand dune.

prompt.text: Press on and see what it is.

rules.text: Progress to entry 19.

flavor.text: It’s not just novacrystal embedded in the spurs of stone, jutting through the sand. There’s much more; seams of ore, invisible from below, but up here an iridescent marvel. You chisel some free. Despite the glint from the ore, you see something on the other side. Something most certainly worth examining.

prompt.text: Clamber over the stone spines.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Fucium ore. Gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 6.

flavor.text: Clawing your way back out of the tunnel is exhausting. But worth it. The earth you disturbed was rich with the bones of Black Diablos’ prey—and now they’re yours.

rules.text: Each hunter gains 1 Boulder Bone. Progress to entry 8.

flavor.text: The creature Black Diablos seized upon out here, in the sand dunes, is difficult to determine. It had wings, but it could be anything; a Pukei-Pukei, perhaps. Or a junior Rathalos, grown lost and disoriented. Either way, Black Diablos won, but it didn’t do so unharmed. You can see fragments of its armour, scattered everywhere.

prompt.text: Collect what you can. Could be invaluable.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Black Diablos Carapace.
Progress to entry 13.

prompt.text: Spend longer among these fragments. You might be able to glean some insight into the creature’s habits.

condition.text: (This option can only be chosen if the hunters have at least 1 Black Spiral Horn in their inventories)

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Black Diablos Carapace and 1 Black Diablos Ridge. Progress to entry 22.

flavor.text: You emerge from the tunnels, out into the heat of the desert. You’re blinded for a moment, the brightness of the sun dazzling after the darkness of the tunnels.

prompt.text: Stop to get your breath and let your eyes adjust.

rules.text: Progress to entry 8.

prompt.text: Start the long hike across the sands.

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 10.

flavor.text: A dead Barroth. Ripped cleanly in two, though the back half is missing. The rest of the carcass might be worth stripping.

prompt.text: Time to get bloody.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Majestic Horn.
Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 10.

flavor.text: Rumbling noises nearby. Not big enough to be Black Diablos, you don’t think. Its speed ensues the noise of its movements are difficult to mistake. But this is still something pretty nasty. It could be the lowing noise of a Barroth you can hear. You stay low; you’re hunting a Diablos, you don’t need any distractions right now.

prompt.text: Track Barroth carefully.

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 16.

prompt.text: Keep your distance. No point getting drawn into battle unnecessarily.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Black Spiral Horn.
Progress to entry 12.

prompt.text: Ignore it. Head for the tunnel entrance instead.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Carbalite ore.
Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 29.

flavor.text: The advice you were given wasn’t exactly comforting: “Be lucky.” But you were given some pieces of the beast to examine, and to take with you. Tokens of good fortune, but also useful insight into how the creature behaves. The hunt is already off to a good start.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Black Diablos Ridge.
Progress to entry 8.

flavor.text: The tunnels are smooth, arid. The cloying, sweet reek of decaying meat and the musty, animal smell of a predator’s secretions infest your nostrils. But you’re on the trail of Black Diablos now. Closing in.

prompt.text: Follow this tunnel, into the darkness.

rules.text: Progress to entry 11.

flavor.text: The broken body of a former hunter is not the sight you wanted to see. Not at all. Black Diablos left the unfortunate in literal pieces, smashing through them and their armour, scattering pieces of them across a wide area. They’re still clutching the gem gifted to them by the First Wyverian.

prompt.text: Pay your respects and press on.

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 28.

prompt.text: There are some valuable gems here. Might be worth examining. Not respectful, but your need is greater than theirs…

rules.text: Each hunter gains 1 Dragonvein Crystal. Progress to entry 18.

flavor.text: The tunnels are studded with pieces of Black Diablos, pieces broken off by the speed and energy of its movements. You pluck some fragments of its carapace from the wall, wondering at the forces generated by a creature of this size moving so quickly.

prompt.text: Continue to follow the tunnels downwards.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Black Diablos Carapace.
Progress to entry 22.

condition.text: (This option can only be chosen if the hunters have at least 1 Black Diablos Carapace in their inventories)

rules.text: Progress to entry 27.

flavor.text: Descending into the darkness of Black Diablos’ tunnels feels a lot less sensible in practice, than it did in theory. But you were getting nowhere on the surface. Better to try and herd the thing in its lair than stumble about in the dust. Or at least, that’s what you keep telling yourself.

prompt.text: Explore the tunnels.

condition.text: (This option can only be chosen if the hunters have at least 1 piece of Black Diablos armour equipped)

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 27.

prompt.text: Wait. You’re sure the beast knows you’re here.

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 34.

flavor.text: The entrance to one of Black Diablos’ tunnels yawns before you; as perfectly round and black as the throat of the creature itself. Dare you venture in?

prompt.text: Head straight in.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Black Diablos Carapace.
Progress to entry 22.

prompt.text: You’re not afraid. You’re just interested in that thing over there.

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 19.

flavor.text: The tunnels stretch on, miles of them unfolding around you. Does Black Diablos double back on itself, you wonder, examining the floor carefully. If it does, and at the speed it travels, a well-made booby trap might be highly effective. And unexpected. Certainly worth some consideration.

prompt.text: Construct a booby trap.

rules.text:
Discard a time card and roll a die.
On a 1-3 progress to entry 14.
On a 4-6 reduce Black Diablos’ health dial by the amount rolled, then progress to entry 23.

prompt.text: Forget it. Keep on this path.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 quality bone and 1 Monster Bone small.
Progress to entry 14.

flavor.text: Ridges rear from the sand, great spines of stone jutting upwards. It might be worth clambering up and surveying the land from above. The fact you can see the persistent glint of crystal embedded in the stone is neither here nor there, of course.

prompt.text: Follow the spines, but stay on the sand.

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 15.

prompt.text: Clamber up. Crystals are always good.

rules.text: Each hunter gains 1 Novacrystal. Progress to entry 9.

flavor.text: The tunnel is huge, deep, running straight into the earth. Black Diablos moves with terrifying speed, excavating tonnes of earth in seconds. And now you’re going into the tunnels, after it.

prompt.text: Head into the darkness.

rules.text: Gain 2 track tokens. Progress to entry 24.

flavor.text: The desert is littered with the remnants of Black Diablos attacks. There barely seems an inch of sand not replete with the debris from its bloody feasting. Bones crunch under every footstep.

prompt.text: Rummage among the debris.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Wyvern Gem and Black Spiral Horn.
Progress to entry 8.

prompt.text: Look out for specific remains.

rules.text:
Each hunter gains 1 Black Diablos Ridge.
Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 26.

flavor.text: The earth disgorges a huge, snarling beast. All teeth, all lolling tongue, all black chitinous armour. It slams into the ground, nearly knocking you to your knees with the force of its landing. Bellowing, Black Diablos charges towards you. Let battle begin!

rules.text: Reveal your track tokens, check the Scoutfly level, and begin the hunting phase.

flavor.text: Black Diablos claws its way up, from the abyss it dwells in. A nightmarish visage of blackened armour, sword-like teeth and a lolling tongue, ravening for meat. Brace yourselves. Battle is joined.

rules.text: The hunters each suffer 1 damage. Reveal your track tokens, check the Scoutfly level, and begin the hunting phase.

flavor.text: As the beast erupts from the sand, in a surge of muscle and carapace and teeth, you’re already upon it, bringing your weapons down in a savage blow. You bring the fight to Black Diablos!

rules.text: Gain 2 track tokens. Reveal your track tokens, check the Scoutfly level, and begin the hunting phase.

flavor.text: It does not take long. The darkness swells, swarms before you, and then spits out Black Diablos. For a moment, you can’t believe it isn’t the shadows come to life, but then it roars so loudly you can feel your spine try to push its way out of your back. The battle begins.

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Reveal your track tokens, check the Scoutfly level, and begin the hunting phase.
